trial_identification.studytitle: Neuromotor assessment in patients with myelomeningocele submitted to intrauterine surgery
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Neuromotor assessment in patients with myelomeningocele submitted to intrauterine surgery

interventions.interventions: Observational Study Period: four years It was observed neuromotor development in patientes that submitted to inrtauterine surgery by Hoffer Classification. It was analyzed the cognitive level by Columbia Mental Scale and the socioeconomic level by Brazilian Economic Classification Test.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The results showed that six cases(100%) that underwent intrauterine surgical repair demonstrated better functional motor development in relation to the anatomic lesion by Hoffer Classification.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Only two patients (33,33%) that underwent intrauterine surgery developed hydrocephalia. It was observed by ressonance magnetic test.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with clinical diagnosis of myelomeningocele Patients submitted to intrauterine surgery Children born by cesarean section
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients with myelomeningocele no submitted to intrauterine surgery

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Napoleao de Barro, 715 6 andar Vila Clementino Sao Paulo Zip code 04039900

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Napoleao de Barros, 715 6 andar Vila Clementino Sao Paulo Zip code 04039900

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Investigate the neuromotor development of patients with myelomeningocele either submitted to intrauterine surgery, describe anatomical and functional motor levels, the hydrocephalia, and analyze socioeconomic and cognitive levels.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Committee Ethic of Federal University of Sao Paulo
